New Records: Sri Lanka's 160-2 chase was their highest score in the tournament
Pathum Nissanka scored an unbeaten 77, his fourth successive fifty
Sadeera Samarawickrama contributed 65 not out after scoring 91 against the Netherlands
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes' 43 was the only significant resistance from England's batting
Lahiru Kumara took 3 wickets for 35 runs, including dismissing Stokes
Sri Lanka's bowlers ripped through England's tail to secure a comprehensive victory
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler won the toss and England opted to bat
Jonny Bairstow survived an lbw chance that was not reviewed
England's middle-order collapsed despite an early slice of luck
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's victory moved them to a better position in the tournament standings
England's loss increased their struggle to qualify
Sri Lanka's dominant performance set them up for a potential knockout stage push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru, India
The pitch conditions were dry and challenging
Sri Lanka's win marked their fourth victory of the tournament
Others: The article also mentioned Afghanistan's shock win over England earlier in the tournament
It highlighted the competitive nature of the World Cup
